title: Bullshit.js
Ask HN: A former employer screwed me
text:
A former employer of mine abused the shit out of me. I have emails and other things which would be super embarrassing for them.

I decided to leave it alone. But the post traumatic stress of what they did to me keeps coming back. I have anger flashes that are intense. It has probably permanently damaged me emotionally and threw a serious disruption into my career.

I am very seriously considering nuking them in the press. And I wasn’t the only one they did it to. I believe they took an approach to try to use harassment to persuade people to quit versus layoffs.

I know if I talk to others, they will just say; “oh bro get a therapist LOL that will fix it.”

On the other hand, what they did was deeply wrong, it seems wrong for me to let it go and I should take this through to its natural conclusion.

If you are going to treat people Like garbage, you deserve what happens next.

For people who are going to respond and be like “oh just see a therapist,” you have to understand that being haunted for years by the incredible stress has been debilitating. I feel I deserve retribution. They have this coming.

Tell HN: ChatGPT can decipher Caesar cypher
text:
No programing code needed.

me: decrypt the following text. It uses the caesar cypher, "ymj fhj xfj zj zixj yjsy xj qjrj fyi qjrj wjrjsy"

chatGPT: The key for this text is 5. Decrypting the text using this key, we get: "this cat ran up the stair with a mouse"

title: Will the US see a ‘richsession’ – or will economic turmoil hit the poor hardest?
Ask HN: How to move from traditional tech into game dev?
text:
Hey all,

I'm keen to learn how you can move from 'traditional' tech roles into game development. I love games and, while I know there are some issues re: salary & hours worked, still think I'd regret not trying it myself.

What are the usual sideways paths one can take to go that way? My tech stack is almost definitely irrelevant; Python, JS, Rust, Haskell, etc...

Any tips from the game devs out there?

title: Ask HN: How to sell renewable energy's carbon credits?
text:
Hi,
My company is a renewable energy company. We have a combination of wind farms, solar farms, hydro power plants that produce around 600,000 carbon credits per year (certified by GCC - Global carbon credit). I would like to ask if I can sell these GCC in the UK/EU market? Any information about this will be very appreciated. Thanks and have a good day!
